sentences.sentence: The Rich Man and the Tanner( 制革工人 )
A tanner( 制革工人 ) started his business next to a rich man’s house.
The rich man found the smell coming from the tanning business so extremely( 极其 ) unpleasant that he told the tanner( 制革工人 ) he must go.
The tanner( 制革工人 ) said that he would, but kept putting off( 推迟 ) the date when he was supposed to move.
The rich man had to speak to him several times about it;
and every time the tanner( 制革工人 ) said he would move very soon.
This went on for some time, till at last the rich man got so used to( 习惯 ) the smell that he no longer noticed it,
and allowed the tanner( 制革工人 ) to stay where he was.
MORAL: With time, one can get used to anything.
The Salt Merchant( 商人 ) and His Donkey( 驴 )
A merchant( 商人 ) took his donkey( 驴 ) to the coast to buy salt.
To get home, he had to cross a river.
However, as the donkey( 驴 ) crossed the river, he tripped and fell into the water.
There was then much less weight on the donkey( 驴 )'s back because the water had melted( 溶解 ) the salt.
The merchant( 商人 ) then took his donkey( 驴 ) back, this time loading( 装载 ) even more salt onto the donkey( 驴 ) than the first time.
When he came again to the river, the donkey( 驴 ) fell down on purpose( 故意地 ) in the same place.
As he got up feeling much lighter, the donkey( 驴 ) felt a sense of victory.
The merchant( 商人 ), however, saw through( 看穿 ) his trick( 诡计 ) and took him to the coast for the third time.
This time he bought some sponges( 海绵 ) instead of salt.
The donkey( 驴 ), again playing the fool( 干蠢事 ), fell down on purpose( 故意地 ) when he reached the river.
However, the sponges( 海绵 ) became full of water, greatly increasing the weight.
So, his trick( 诡计 ) failed, for now he carried on his back a double weight.
MORAL: The same plan will not suit( 适合 ) all situations.
The Scorpion( 蝎子 ) and the Frog( 青蛙 )
A scorpion( 蝎子 ) and a frog( 青蛙 ) met beside a river.
The scorpion( 蝎子 ) asked the frog( 青蛙 ),
“Please, Mr. Frog( 青蛙 ), would you agree to carry me across this river on your back, since you are such a good swimmer?”
The frog( 青蛙 ) replied, “How can I trust you? You sting( 蛰 ) and kill many animals.
How do I know you won’t sting( 蛰 ) me?”
The scorpion( 蝎子 ) said, “Don’t be silly. Why would I want to sting( 蛰 ) you?
After all, if I did sting( 蛰 ) you, then I would die as well as you.
Do you think I am stupid?”
So the frog( 青蛙 ) agreed to carry the scorpion( 蝎子 ) across the river on his back.
But halfway across the river, the scorpion( 蝎子 ) stung( 蛰 ) the frog( 青蛙 ).
The frog( 青蛙 )’s muscles( 肌肉 ) no longer worked, and he started to sink( 下沉 ).
Just before he drowned( 淹死 ), he asked the scorpion( 蝎子 ),
“Why did you sting( 蛰 ) me, since if I die, you die as well?”
The scorpion( 蝎子 ) replied, “I can’t help it, it’s in my nature.”
MORAL: Don’t expect people to change.
The Seller of Images
A man made a wooden statue( 雕像 ) of the god Hermes and tried to sell it.
When no-one wanted to buy it, he tried to sell it by claiming that the statue( 雕像 ) would make whoever owned it very rich.
“Why don’t you keep it for yourself, then?” he was asked.
He replied, “I need money quickly, but the god works slowly.”
MORAL: When people make you good offers, think about their reasons.

question.cn: 在故事The Rich Man and the Tanner中，富人最后为什么允许制革工人留在那里？
question.en: In the story The Rich Man and the Tanner, why did the rich man allow the tanner to stay?

options.cn: 制革工人给了富人一大笔钱。
options.en: The tanner gave the rich man a large amount of money.

options.cn: 富人习惯了这种气味，不再注意。
options.en: The rich man got used to the smell and no longer noticed it.

analysis: 文中提到：“This went on for some time, till at last the rich man got so used to the smell that he no longer noticed it and allowed the tanner to stay where he was.”富人逐渐熟悉了这种气味，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Salt Merchant and His Donkey中，驴故意摔倒的目的是什么？
question.en: In the story The Salt Merchant and His Donkey, why did the donkey fall into the water on purpose?

options.en: Because he wanted to lighten the load.
Because he wanted to drink some water.

analysis: 文中提到：“There was then much less weight on the donkey's back because the water had melted the salt.”可知，驴的目的是减轻负重，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Salt Merchant and His Donkey中，驴的诡计第三次成功了吗？
question.en: In the story The Salt Merchant and His Donkey, did the donkey's trick succeed the third time?

analysis: 文中提到：“However, the sponges became full of water, greatly increasing the weight. So, his trick failed, for now he carried on his back a double weight.”第三次驴驮的是海绵，所以没有成功，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Scorpion and the Frog中，为什么蝎子会蛰青蛙？
question.en: In the story The Scorpion and the Frog, why did the scorpion sting the frog?

options.en: Because the frog attacked him first.
Because the scorpion hated the frog.

analysis: 文中提到：“The scorpion replied, ‘I can't help it, it's my nature.’”可知，蝎子的本性使他咬了青蛙，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Scorpion and the Frog中，蝎子过河了吗？
question.en: In the story The Scorpion and the Frog, did the scorpion cross the river?

analysis: 文中提到：“The frog's muscles no longer worked, and he started to sink.”可知最后青蛙沉到了河里，蝎子在他的背上，也沉到河里了，因此选B。
